message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CYBER, cs.MM

This paper discusses the issue of selective exposure to information on social media sites, which falls under the category of social media and online social networks. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the concept of residential segregation and applies it to information segregation, which falls under the category of sociology and social psychology. Therefore, cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences) is the second most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the quantification of information segregation, which involves information retrieval and ranking algorithms, falling under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also discusses the potential impact of information segregation on cybersecurity, which falls under the category of cybersecurity (cs.CYBER). Finally, the paper discusses the potential use of visualizations to represent information segregation, which falls under the category of multimedia (cs.MM).
